name: Sanjeev Kapoor
bio: Sanjeev Kapoor is an Indian celebrity chef, entrepreneur, and television personality. He has hosted several cooking shows on television and is the author of several cookbooks. He is also the founder of a successful chain of restaurants in India.

recipes.title: Butter Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken with 1 tsp ginger garlic paste and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a pan and fry chicken till golden brown. Keep aside.
In the same pan, add more butter if required and fry onions till golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste and fry for a minute.
Add tomato puree, kasuri methi, red chili powder, garam masala powder and salt. Cook till oil separates.
Add cream and fried chicken. Cook for 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

recipes.title: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Cut paneer into cubes and shallow fry till golden brown. Keep aside.
Heat butter in a pan and fry onions till golden brown.
Add ginger garlic paste and fry for a minute.
Add tomato puree, kasuri methi, red chili powder, garam masala powder and salt. Cook till oil separates.
Add cream and fried paneer. Cook for 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

recipes.title: Tandoori Chicken
instructions: Mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala powder, lemon juice, and salt in a bowl.
Add chicken to the mixture and marinate for 4-6 hours.
Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Place the marinated chicken on a greased baking tray and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Turn the chicken pieces over and bake for another 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with onion rings and lemon wedges and serve hot.

name: Vikas Khanna
bio: Vikas Khanna is an Indian-American chef, restaurateur, cookbook writer, filmmaker, humanitarian, and judge on the television show MasterChef India. He has written over 35 cookbooks and has hosted several cooking shows on television.

recipes.title: Paneer Tikka Masala
instructions: Mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala powder, lemon juice, and salt in a bowl.
Add paneer cubes to the mixture and marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and cook the marinated paneer cubes until golden brown.
In another pan, heat butter and add chopped onions, ginger, and garlic.
Add tomato puree and cook until the mixture thickens.
Add cream and the cooked paneer cubes to the tomato mixture.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

recipes.title: Tandoori Chicken
instructions: Mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala powder, lemon juice, and salt in a bowl.
Add chicken to the mixture and marinate for 4-6 hours.
Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Place the marinated chicken on a greased baking tray and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Turn the chicken pieces over and bake for another 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with onion rings and lemon wedges and serve hot.

recipes.title: Kashmiri Dum Aloo
instructions: Heat oil in a kadhai, add cumin seeds, asafoetida and saute till fragrant.
Add ginger and saute for half a minute.
Add fennel seeds, green cardamoms, cinnamon stick and cloves and saute for a minute.
Add tomato puree and saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add Kashmiri red chilli powder, fennel powder, dry ginger powder, garam masala powder, sugar and salt and mix well.
Add baby potatoes and mix well.
Add yogurt and mix well.
Add water and mix well.
Cover and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Madhur Jaffrey
bio: Madhur Jaffrey is an Indian-born actress, food and travel writer, and television personality. She is also a prolific author of cookbooks, and is known for bringing Indian cuisine to the western world through her books and cooking shows.

recipes.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces and set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne pepper, and salt.
Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
Preheat the broiler.
Thread the chicken onto skewers and place on a broiler pan. Broil until cooked through, about 10 minutes, turning occasionally.
Meanwhile, melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add the cream and bring to a simmer.
Add the cooked chicken to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

recipes.title: Paneer Tikka Masala
instructions: Mix yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala powder, lemon juice, and salt in a bowl.
Add paneer cubes to the mixture and marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and cook the marinated paneer cubes until golden brown.
In another pan, heat butter and add chopped onions, ginger, and garlic.
Add tomato puree and cook until the mixture thickens.
Add cream and the cooked paneer cubes to the tomato mixture.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Ranveer Brar
bio: Ranveer Brar is an Indian celebrity chef, television host, judge, and food stylist. He has hosted several cooking shows on television and is the author of multiple cookbooks. He is known for his innovative and contemporary take on traditional Indian cuisine.

name: Atul Kochhar
bio: Atul Kochhar is an Indian-born, British-based Michelin-starred chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He is the owner and head chef of the acclaimed Benares restaurant in London, which serves modern Indian cuisine.

name: Hari Nayak
bio: Hari Nayak is an Indian chef, restaurateur, and cookbook author based in the United States. He has worked in several Michelin-starred restaurants and is known for his modern and inventive take on Indian cuisine.
